hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash
### assume etl role aws sts assume-role --duration-seconds 900 --role-arn arn:aws:iam::736265540791:role/dbgap-etl --role-session-name "s3-test" > assume-role-output.txt
export AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=`grep AccessKeyId assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=`grep SecretAccessKey assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SESSION_TOKEN=`grep SessionToken assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"`
mkdir data mkdir data/decoded mkdir completed mkdir hierarchies mkdir processing
find data/ -type f -exec rm -rf {} \; find processing/ -type f -exec rm -rf {} \; find completed/ -type f -exec rm -rf {} \; rm -rf pic-sure-hpds/
aws s3 cp ${managed_inputs} data/
aws s3 cp ${metadata_file} data/metadata.json
aws s3 cp s3://avillach-73-bdcatalyst-etl/general/data/PatientPool.txt data/
unset AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID unset AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY unset AWS_SESSION_TOKEN
# Removing iterative approach # This process should be handled with care as patient sequencing is critical to ensure data integrity
#awk -F, '{print $1","$2","$3","$8","$9}' data/Managed_Inputs.csv > inputs.csv
# Generate mappings #cat inputs.csv #IFS=',' #[ ! -f inputs.csv ] #while read abv_name stdy_id stdy_type data_ready data_processed #do
#if [[ "${data_ready,,}" == "yes" ]]; then
# if [[ ${stdy_type,,} == "topmed" ]] || [[ ${stdy_type,,} == "parent" ]]; then
### assume etl role aws sts assume-role --duration-seconds 3600 --role-arn arn:aws:iam::736265540791:role/dbgap-etl --role-session-name "s3-test" > assume-role-output.txt
export AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=`grep AccessKeyId assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=`grep SecretAccessKey assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SESSION_TOKEN=`grep SessionToken assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"`
echo "aws s3 cp s3://avillach-73-bdcatalyst-etl/${abv_name,,}/rawData/ data/ --recursive --exclude="*" --include="${stdy_id}*" --quiet" #aws s3 cp s3://avillach-73-bdcatalyst-etl/${abv_name,,}/data/${abv_name^^}_PatientMapping.v2.csv data/ --quiet aws s3 cp s3://avillach-73-bdcatalyst-etl/${abv_name,,}/decoded_data/ beforeConversion/ --recursive --quiet touch data/${abv_name^^}_PatientMapping.v2.csv for file in beforeConversion/*; do echo "$file" FILE_ENCODING=$(file -i $file) iconv -f 8859_1 -t UTF-8//TRANSLIT "$file" -o data/$(basename $file) done
java -jar jars/HPDSPatientNumTracker.jar
aws s3 cp data/${abv_name^^}_PatientMapping.v2.csv s3://avillach-73-bdcatalyst-etl/${abv_name,,}/data/${abv_name^^}_PatientMapping.v2.csv aws s3 cp data/PatientPool.txt s3://avillach-73-bdcatalyst-etl/general/data/PatientPool.txt
# fi # fi #done < inputs.csv
